intro: Tricalysia bequaertii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a spreading canopy with pinnate leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Tricalysia bequaertii is also valued for its ability to provide shade and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
